Reviews.Title: “wouldn't go there again...”
Reviews.Author: granniesmith
Reviews.Content: just stayed one night. glad it wasn't for longer. staff at front desk not friendly at all. halls smelled of cigarettes even in non smoking area. heard somone complaining of mold on their bagel at the breakfast bar. no elevator. entrance door lock didn't work so anyone could get in - unsafe. bathroom not very clean. bad experience...

Reviews.Title: “"It was ok"”
Reviews.Author: prtony2019
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok in someways.The staff at the front desk were nice to us greeted my husband every morning.My kids liked the pool area with the picnic tables has it's own lifeguard by the pool, we also liked the sand by the volleyball court.They should plant like flowers if they would do that it would be nice.The rooms were ok except the shower part it had mold on shower tiles me and my husband brought bleach spray and did that every morning.They need new curtains and to clean the rugs my kids feet were dirty had to wear slippers.My husband brought us breakfast in the room.My husband likes it for the fact that it has the sliding doors that leads you to the pool and the parking lot because we stayed on the 1st floor.The beds need new bedspreads had like cigarette burns and it was a non smoking room has a mini refrigerator and microwave.We stayed there 2 times we like it's ok.There are alot of stores and places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Misty P
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst hotel our family has ever stayed in. When we first walked in we weren't greeted by the front desk clerk, but was told to hold on while she continued her converstation on her personal cell phone (to which she was cussing and yelling in front of our 2 year old). After about waiting for ten minutes she finally got us a room which we asked for a room with one bed, she then said that she gave us a two bed room because it was "bigger". After having to drive around to the back of the hotel and walk up the none air-conditioned flight of stairs and hallway, we entered our room. The room smelled like smoke and dirty feet. The entire room was disgusting. They were cobwebs in ever corner of the ceiling, there were burn holes in the blankets, the balcony (which did not have a secure locking system) was covered in cigarettes, the lawn chairs that were on the balcony were covered in dust, the bathroom hardware was dusty and dirty, when we turned the shower on it smelled like fish, there was trash in the drawers from preivous guests, the channels on the television that were promised were not there (no kid friendly channels at all). On top of everything the fridge was broken which ended up spoiling a lot of our food that we have brought with us, the air conditioner had a sensor that only turned on when someone was in the room and the thing didn't even work because someone had broken the knob off. When we called down to the front desk (after fixing it ourselves) the front desk clerk said he would still have someone come look at it because "we'd just complain about it again". No one came and looked at it and we ended up sticking a ballon in front of the sensor to keep the room cool. But the worst part about our stay was the 2 guys trying to break into the bar and pool, which was right outside our room. They were drinking in the parking lot and going in and out of the hotel. There is no sercurity at all at this hotel, NONE of the locks on the doors work and we feared for our safety. Please do yourselves a favor and DO NOT stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for a family getaway”
Reviews.Author: karamyl
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for a summer stay, especially with children. It have on the premises an outdoor pool that goes up to 8 feet, a kiddie pool, playground, sand volleyball court and picnic tables along with lounge chairs. The continental breakfast is also good.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: myktdid
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a family event and this hotel was the closest that had an opening. We were apprehensive at first and upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised. The facility is old, but recently remodeled and it appeared they were not finished--which was fine. The room was nice and the bed comfortable. It could have been a bit cleaner, especially the bathroom and around the "edges". The breakfast selection was not as good as other places we have stayed, but the coffee was fresh and hot.

Reviews.Title: “Not Terrible-Not Great”
Reviews.Author: run50states
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel due to location to an event and price. It wasn't a terrible, but wasn't worth the $100 per night. There were tractor trailers parked in the lot overnight and a broken down car parked outside the entrance that was there the entire weekend. In our room, the sliding glass door didn't close properly and the TV volume kept going off. Thankfully, the air conditioning worked and the continental breakfast was decent. There are restaurants and shops in the area which was nice, but the way the roads are set up made it very difficult to navigate without constantly having to stop, turn around, and do u-turns.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Mainercoast
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights while visiting Sesame Place and Philadelphia. We had a room on the 1st floor with a double bed at $63/night. The location was just okay. It was very central to Sesame Place and PHiladelphia but wasn't real conveniently close to either of them. The road has 12 lanes of traffic broken into groups of threes and is very tricky to navigate. When we got to the room I checked it over for any potential problems and cleanliness. Everything looked okay except the wall near the bed had old soda splash stains all over it. When I ironed a shirt the ironing board wouldn't fold back up and the cleaning lady never dis it for us either. The hotel entrance us not secure at all and the lock is broken. The 1st day things were okay but day 2 was AWFUL. I put the card on our door for the room to be cleaned. The options on the card are "sleep in" and "freshen up" I made extra sure it was on "freshen up". We led for the day and when we returned at 9pm our room had not been touched AT ALL. I called the front desk and the woman was INCREDIBLY rude and said there was nothing she could do because housekeeping had all gone home. The best she could do was bring us some towels. I was irate. They should have someone on duty to take care of problems like that. What angered me most was she seemed to think I was lying that my card was on "freshen up" as she claimed the housekeeper reported it as "do not disturb". Things were okay to that point but that put me over the edge. I was a GUEST. when you are far from home and living out of a hotel with a toddler you need to have things like the trash done EVERY day. Her attitude and unwillingness to help was UNACCEPTABLE. when we returned on our 3rd day everything had been cleaned (except the soda stained wall). The bed was hard as a rock and the rooms smelled musty. The hall was hot and stuffy and smokey and the breakfast was stale and bland. The pay phones (not for me but still) were both out of order. The one computer "business center" was also out of order. We never saw the pool. I would bit stay here again simply due to the ridiculously small rooms, hard bed and rude staff. Next time I will go somewhere closer to my destination as well.

Reviews.Title: “The worst of the worst”
Reviews.Author: 128_days_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old, moldy and overal dirty. The room carpet smells like old cigarrettes. The doors are broken, paint is cracked and the bathroom is filthy. The receptionist looks like coming form a 50s B movie.The rooom was so bad that I ask to change rooms. She answer that it was booked as is and the rate was non refundable. If it was not so late I would look for some place else. I stayed one night and left with getting my refund for the other night. This place needs management or just close it down. I prefer to pay 20 dollars more and stay some place clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay to see the big city”
Reviews.Author: steveh327
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Ramada Inn for two nights in a row. When we arrived for the first night the staff was extremely helpful in getting us our room. Upon arriving to our first room, everything seemed great, especially for a little older hotel. We did notice one thing though, that the security bar on the sliding glass door was broken. This really wouldn't have been a problem to us if we had been on the second floor. Being on the first floor in an unfamiliar area (not saying that its not a safe area), you want to make sure your sliding glass door has security locks. So we went back down to the front desk and asked to be relocated. The desk clerk was very friendly and had no problem relocating us to a second floor room. The room was very cozy for an older room, it had a fridge and a microwave. The bed was very nice, as well as the bathroom. We had great night sleeps for both nights that we were there. The room was remade when we returned from doing touristy things during the day. The breakfast was great. If you love French Toast, you will love the breakfast. They also have a variety of other items as well such as bagels, danishes, fruits, and yogurts. Overall this hotel was a great experience for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP”
Reviews.Author: nsanefire
Reviews.Content: WOW... this is hands down one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed at in my entire life. My group had a flight canceled so we had to stay here. First off, it was the middle of summer & half of the a/c's didn't work at all - they just blew warm air. The place smelled like an ash tray, nothing - and I mean nothing - in the place was clean - everything felt sticky, everything in whole hotel was at least 20 or 30 years old, the carpet & furniture in each of our rooms were full of stains - all 20 years old or more and Lord only knows of what - and to top it off the shower & shower curtains were stained with mildew & not even cleaned. Seriously, you could take a dump on the floor, rub it in, & no one would be able to tell the difference. Basicly, this is a hotel fit for a cheap prostitute but I don't even think that they would stay here. This hotel is why I will NEVER stay at another Ramada Inn - PERIOD!

Reviews.Title: “Smokey hotel and that needs better variety of breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: kerijo98
Reviews.Content: We went here for 7 days for our family trip to Sesame Place. It was in a good location,but 12 lanes of traffic and nothing too close to go to get anything. We wrote on our reservation that our daughter had severe asthma and needed to be far away from smoking and we arrive LATE and we walked into our room and it smelled like an ashtray, so we went to the front desk and they got us another room next to the room we were supposed to have and we settled in an the room did not smell smoky at all. When I got up in the morning, to take a shower, there were snicker bar wrappers on top of the shelves in the shower and it was very dusty. WE have an 2 year old that is potty trained and I set her on the potty and there was a ring in the toilet and dust and dirt on the floor and the toilet was not clean... so I cleaned it myself. We went to breakfast and it was an egg that was rubbery and they had the SAME breakfast every morning. The only fruit were oranges and maybe a banana. They put 3 out one day. We were there for 6 nights and no variety. The only people that were friendly were the 2 cleaning people. One in the morning would smile and say GOOD Morning and the other one gave my girls balloons in the room after cleaning it one day. There was 1 women that was tall and crabby! The pool was nice, but shuts down @ 8 pm and they had volleyball leagues and they kind of got loud. We were in the way back and could not hear any traffic. Also, there were 5 stray cats they would hid in the woods and go into the dumpster and eat. So, I would not go back to that hotel with kids- The fitness room was OLD stuff and the treadmill did not work. The laundry room did not have any soaps or anything in their box.

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada Philadelphia
HotelInfo.Address: 11580 Roosevelt Blvd, I-95 exit 35/PA Turnpike 351, Philadelphia, PA 19116
